Conversational.name: Deception
Conversational.description: Deceive or otherwise disguise your true intentions. Lie well.

Conversational.name: Intuition
Conversational.description: Determine when others are being truthful, see into their true intentions, and determine details about their personality. Read the room.

Conversational.name: Intimidation
Conversational.description: Coerce or frighten others through threats or mere presence. Exude menace.

Conversational.name: Mercantile
Conversational.description: Haggle for a good deal and convince others to buy your goods at higher prices. Seal the deal.

Conversational.name: Persuasion
Conversational.description: Convince others to see your point of view or agree with your requests. Win them over.

Conversational.name: Performance
Conversational.description: Entertain or captivate an audience through various forms of artistic expression. Steal the spotlight.

Conversational.name: Wit
Conversational.description: Think quickly, solve problems under pressure, and find clever or unexpected solutions. Used to outmaneuver others in conversation, notice logical flaws, devise plans on the fly, or grasp subtle patterns in complex situations. Outsmart everyone.

Scholarly.name: Arcane
Scholarly.description: Knowledge and understanding of arcane principles and spellcraft. Useful for identifying the properties of scrolls, magical items, and magical mechanisms. Master the void.

Scholarly.name: Architecture
Scholarly.description: Knowledge of building design, construction methods, and structural integrity, be it current, historical, familiar, or foreign. Read the walls.

Scholarly.name: Decorum
Scholarly.description: Knowledge of the mores, taboos, speech, and behavior of the elite and well-educated. Mingle with the patrician.

Scholarly.name: Herbalism
Scholarly.description: Knowledge of plants and their uses, and the ability to gather them effectively. Pluck with purpose.

Scholarly.name: History
Scholarly.description: Knowledge of past events, cultures, and significant figures. Understand the past.

Scholarly.name: Linguistics
Scholarly.description: Knowledge of languages and the ability to understand and communicate in them. Break any silence.

Scholarly.name: Medicine
Scholarly.description: Knowledge of healing practices, diseases, and medical treatments. Patch everyone up.

Scholarly.name: Nature
Scholarly.description: Knowledge of the natural world, including flora, fauna, and ecosystems. Trust the wilds.

Scholarly.name: Religion
Scholarly.description: Knowledge of religious practices, deities, and spiritual beliefs. Know the gods' nature.

Scholarly.name: Streetwise
Scholarly.description: Knowledge of the tendencies, practices, and dialects of common folk. Speak slang.

Perceptive.name: Investigation
Perceptive.description: Analyze and deduce information from clues and evidence, as well as search specific, small areas. Put the pieces together.

Perceptive.name: Perception
Perceptive.description: Observe and interpret details in the environment. Notice every aspect.

Perceptive.name: Tracking
Perceptive.description: Follow and interpret tracks and signs left by creatures or people. Spot the traces.

Physical.name: Acrobatics
Physical.description: Conduct feats of agility, balance, and coordination. Stick the landing.

Physical.name: Athletics
Physical.description: Perform physically demanding tasks such as running, swimming, and climbing. Go the distance.

Physical.name: Brawn
Physical.description: Exert physical strength and power. Flex your muscles.

Physical.name: Reflex
Physical.description: React quickly and avoid danger. Don't blink.

Physical.name: Stealth
Physical.description: Move quietly, remain unnoticed, and hide. Embrace the shadows.

Physical.name: Thievery
Physical.description: Pick locks, pockets, and perform other acts of sleight of hand. Take what's theirs.

Practical.name: Alchemy
Practical.description: Create potions and poisons from a myriad of ingredients. Become the brewmaster.

Practical.name: Animal Husbandry
Practical.description: The care, breeding, and training of domesticated animals. Heed the herd.

Practical.name: Animal Intuition
Practical.description: Understand and communicate with wild animals. Train the untamed.

Practical.name: Cartography
Practical.description: Create and read maps. Chart the unknown.

Practical.name: Cooking
Practical.description: Prepare and cook a variety of foods. Feed the world.

Practical.name: Enchanting
Practical.description: Enhance otherwise mundane items through crystalline sorcery, granting them additional magical effects. Bind the arcane.

Practical.name: Fishing
Practical.description: Catch fish and other aquatic creatures with both net and rod. Snag the lunker.

Practical.name: Mining
Practical.description: Identify and excavate rare metals and minerals. Dig deep.

Practical.name: Navigation
Practical.description: Determine and follow a course or maneuver through foreign terrain or seas. Stay the course.

Practical.name: Sailing
Practical.description: Navigate and operate a boat or ship. Ride the wind.

Practical.name: Scrivening
Practical.description: Copy or create written works and scrolls. Ink the page.

Practical.name: Smithing
Practical.description: Work with metal to create tools, weapons, and armor. Mold the metal.

Practical.name: Survival
Practical.description: Endure and thrive in harsh environments, hunt wild game. Conquer the wilds.

Practical.name: Tinkering
Practical.description: Craft, repair, and modify mechanical devices. Acknowledge the automatic.
